{{also|无名指}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=无名指|type=21|lit=unnamed finger}}

===Etymology===
Literally, "unnamed finger". Named as such as there are names for all the other fingers on one's hand except for this one.
{{rfe|zh|Dubious and ambiguous etymology.}}

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=wúmíngzhǐ
|c=mou4 ming4 zi2
|mn=bû-bêng-cháiⁿ
|h=pfs=mò-miàng-chṳ́/mò-miàng-chí
|cat=n
}}

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# [[ring finger]]

{{zh-cat|Fingers}}

==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|む|めい|し}}
{{bor|ja|ltc|sort=むめいし|無名指|tr={{IPAchar|/mɨo miᴇŋ t͡ɕˠiɪX/}}|lit=no, without + name + finger}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} reading ''mou<sup>4</sup> ming<sup>4</sup> zi<sup>2</sup>'', {{etyl|hak|-}} ''mò-miàng-chí''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|むめいし|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|むめいし}}

# {{synonym of|lang=ja|薬指}}: [[ring finger]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|||ゆび|sort=ななしゆび}}
{{cal|ja|sort=ななしゆび|etyl lang=ltc|etyl term=無名指|etyl t=[[unnamed]] [[finger]]}}, swapping the readings of the first two kanji to match Japanese word order.

This reading is more commonly spelled {{ja-l|名無し指}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ななしゆび|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}
